May 12, 1959
Dr. Maurice F. Seay, Director
Division of Education
W. K. Kellogg Foundation
250 Champion Street
Battle Creek, Michigan
Dear Maurice:
You will recall that we have discussed the fact that our Associate Director
and 1 have University faculty contracts which cover the period September 1,
1958 to August 31, 1959, and that this will pose a special problem in rela¬
tion to our new grant which begins July 1, 1959.
Since the new grant is being made direct to the NAEB, rather than to the
University of Illinois, some arrangements will need to be made in order
to permit Mr. Hill and me to complete our contract commitments to the Uni¬
versity and to enable Mr. Hill to complete the tenth full year of employ¬
ment with the University, which is a pre-requisite to qualifying for retire¬
ment benefits ♦ This would mean that we two (but no other members of the
staff) would continue to * 'work for the University* * until August 31, 1959,
and we would change over to the new budget (and be paid by the NAEB
Treasurer rather than the University) beginning September 1, 1959.
It is probable that we will have a balance In our W. K. Kellogg Foundation
grant at the University, as of July 1, 1959, sufficient to pay our salaries
for July and August, in view of the fact that a sum of $4,100 was added to
the current year's operating grant by the Foundation at the time the check
was forwarded and is being held as a "contingency item" and is not in¬
cluded in our regular operating budget for 1958-59. The funds needed to
pay the salaries for Mr. Hill and me for July and August are indicated
below:
Salary, Executive Director (2 months)
Salary, Associate Director (2 months)
$2,000.00
1,533.34
Retirement Benefits (8 .477%)
Workmen's Compensation (1%)
299.52
35.33
Total for July and August
$3,868.19
